reviews.review: It's a masterpiece; nothing more to say :)

Ну... в принципі... 5 разів пройшов на піратці, 3 на ліцензії, 6 разів пройшов кооп (з різними людьми), найшов завдяки цій грі друга. Скажу так: гра шедевральна, на рівні Half-life, але була вона такою лише у свій час, на жаль всі речі забуваються, і цю игру чекала така ж доля. На СЬОГОДНІШНІЙ день, онлайн 1К, правда під час пошуку напарника, тільки 1-2 гри, і то або хлопець який хоче "повиконувати" досягення з noclip або чувак у якого мізки зовсім пусті, і він навіть найпростіших вказівок не розуміє. В плані онлайну гра сьогодні проиграє, але також є сюжетна компанія, вона хороша, мені особисто сподобалась, раджу, та у деяких може скластись враження, що сюжет простий, але це і добре. Також після проходження компанії, є камери спільноти, і це також добре, так як деякі із них реально прекрасні, в деяких є свої нововведення, нові сюжети. Ну і користувацькі доповнення(Portal Stories:Mel, Apeture Tag, Thinking with time machine), нові механіки, історії, персонажі. І так, скажу просто і зрозуміло: Гра варта своїх горшей!! Купляйте)))(і та, я забув про досягнення, вони реально хардкорні(особливо "Майстер порталів"))
çok güzel zama geçirmek için tam uygun bir oyun . :)
Круть)
Phenomenal, Funny and Brilliant. Excellent gameplay, Excellent storyline that is, in my opinion, an instant classic! 10/10 would recommend
Super Super Super :) :) :) :)

In a way, "recommending" or "not recommending" this game is too simple.

It took me 8 hours to finish the single-player campaign. I breezed through the first third all the while having to think a lot to make stuff work. It was fun. 

I'm not usually one to predict parts of the story. Portal 2, sadly, was overly predictable in every way. In the second third of the game new elements get introduced and levels became more trial and error yet started to become repetitive. In the last third I just wanted to get through the game.

If you love puzzles, I recommend it. If you want a well-paced puzzle game, I don't recommend it.

SUMMARY
After a short Portal this game comes with pretty much the same gameplay and main "cool stuff". However it logicaly continues in the good story, it adds new types of puzzles and runs smooth with not so bad graphics even after years. A good sequel, definitely worth playing after the 1st Portal.

89/100

PROS
- even with just few characters the game is able to build a graduating story
- the game gradually adds new types og puzzles so it doesn't stop being fun to play by the time
- graphics look just fine, has low HW needs
- after story mode there is a good coop mod

CONS
- some locations could look nicer or more detailed
- the game could give more information about its story and world lore

Portal 2 - Manchester 4, is a physics puzzle platformer akin to it's namesake predecessor, and this time Valve pounces on the jumping board, breaks the springs and slingshots itself right into space. 

Portal was build on the Half-Life engine by Valve to keep its audience docile while they were waiting for the next installment  of the Gordon Freeman epic, and introduced a fun central mechanic around which everything was build. You have a gun that creates 2 portals that are linked and solve puzzles with it. This Portal edition utilizes the same portal gun with a few additions including acceleration & bounce gel, lightbridges and a decent solo campaign. It's was suprising how they were able to flesh out the character of the AI that runs Black Mesa. After a while the solo campaign puzzles get insultingly easy as they transform into a sight-seeing tour instead, but the ride is a nice experience.

When you're done with that, get a friend and explore the co-op missions! You can still hear Glados' condescending monologues while puzzling together. It is hilarious! Best experienced in local co-op, in my humble opinion. 
Played all of it and you still want more levels? 
The Community Hub has got you covered. Play in rooms created by your peer portalers, or create your own puzzlemaps in the Steam Workshop. Hello infinite content!

Portal 2 - Arsenal 1 is worth your money! There's a lot of fun in fucking about with a friend in a physics-defying playrun.
Galera q quiser jogar o modo multiplayer é só me adicionar

The first criticism is the same as my criticism of Portal 1:

"This game pulled me out of immersion within the first few minutes. I like to be able to imagine I am the character in a game, in the scenario created, and escape into that world for a while. Half Life 2 failed for me, and Portal made the same errors. In this case: the game begins with you waking up. And you seem to have had radical surgery, with metal bolted onto your bones. Don't you think you would examine that? Check your legs? Is it bolted or strapped on? Could it be removed and you restored to a normal body, or are you permanently disfigured? Does it hurt to walk on it? To fall 50 feet and land on it? The game doesn't answer any of this, meaning I was immediately removed from the character. Either she had information that hadn't been shared with the player (making it difficult to _be_ her in the game), or she somehow doesn't notice or comment upon the fact that she may have been mutilated in her sleep (again, making it impossible to empathise with the character). This could have easily been rectified by a few seconds of close-up, maybe a wince; perhaps later a comment on it, or a sign about the surgery. To gloss over something that would be so major in a person's life is bizarre."

I also noticed (which I don't remember from Portal 1) that picking up the portal gun now gives you X-ray vision. You can see where portals are even when they're out of sight, through walls. It is often confusing (sometimes they looked like the gun sights); unnecessary (it wasn't useful to me in the slightest); and it made no sense (the character wasn't looking through special sights on the gun or anything like that). I wouldn't have minded if it was a feature you could turn off, but I couldn't find any such setting in the menu.

Again, the actual puzzling is generally okay, but weird things like that kept distracting me.

全方面超越前作的神作。

+依然是极具创意和想象力的谜题设计，比之前作内容更多，流程更长
+增加了剧情，我爱GLaDos（她复活的这一段场景，堪称惊艳）
+双人模式（首先，你得。。。）
+创意工坊，讲道理创意工坊我能玩一辈子

-比起前作似乎多了许多繁杂的场景，如果说前作是实验室，那本作就是工厂；同时加载时间也大大延长了，本身倒不是什么问题，只是对比起前作的几乎无缝加载就稍显累赘
What kept this game fun  is no the massive story as i thought it was a bit too bloated but rather the co-op and the community test chambers, which is probably why i still play this game
Good game to play with friends :)

A great game overall. An interesting story, puzzles oyu can solve, puzzles you can mess around with instead of solve, an evil ball that turns its former boss into a potato, turrets you can waste time on by knocking them over and then throwing them into an abyss, and a neat look into the original Aperture Science lab. The only problem with the game is that you can easily finish it in one afternoon, but its still a good game.
